Mullu Muruku

Mullu MurukuÂ  is a popular South Indian snack and traditional delicacy. It is a type of savory, crunchy snack that is commonly prepared during festivals, special occasions, or simply enjoyed as an evening snack with tea or coffee.

The name "Mullu Muruku" translates to "thorn-shaped snack" in Tamil, which accurately describes its appearance.It is made from a mixture of Rice Flour, Fried Farm, Urad Dhal, Moong Dhal, Refined Oil,Salt.. entry.title: Chettinad Kai Murukku
entry.summary:
Vendor: Arvind Chettinad Snacks
Type: Veg
Price: 220.00

Our handmade Chettinad Kai Muruku â€”a snack that combines skill, taste, and crunch. Hand-twisted, perfectly crunchy and spiral in shape. Order your murukku online now.

Â 

Product Information

Â Ingredients:

Â Rice Flour, Fried Gram, Ginger, Garlic, Refined Oil, Salt

Storage:

Store in an airtight container

Shelf Life:Â 

30 Days

Â Best for:

Festivals, tea-time, or gifting, this crispy delight is a must-have for every snack lover.

Â What is Chettinad Kai Murukku?

Chettinad Kai Muruku (also called as suthu murukku, spring murukku or spiral murukku) is a traditional South Indian snack known for its hand-twisted, spiral shape. This snack is famous for its crunchy texture and the intricate, labor-intensive handwork that goes into shaping each murukku, making it a popular delicacy

How is it made?

Made with a mix of Rice Flour, Fried Gram, Ginger and Garlic, each murukku is hand-twisted for swirls with care and deep-fried to golden, crispy perfection.

Â FAQS about Kai Murukku

Â What are the ingredients used in your Kai Murukku?

Rice Flour, Fried Gram, Ginger, Garlic, Oil, Salt

Why is it named Kai Murukku?

â€˜Kaiâ€™ means hand in Tamil. Kai Murukku is named so because the swirls are shaped by hand, unlike other murukkus that are made using a press or mould.

Â How is Kai Murukku different from regular murukku?

Regular murukku is made with a press, while Kai Murukku is twisted by hand, which makes it more authentic and traditional.

Â 

Â

entry.summary:
Vendor: Arvind Chettinad Snacks
Type: Veg
Price: 170.00

Mullu Muruku

Mullu MurukuÂ  is a popular South Indian snack and traditional delicacy. It is a type of savory, crunchy snack that is commonly prepared during festivals, special occasions, or simply enjoyed as an evening snack with tea or coffee.

The name "Mullu Muruku" translates to "thorn-shaped snack" in Tamil, which accurately describes its appearance.It is made from a mixture of Rice Flour, Fried Farm, Urad Dhal, Moong Dhal, Refined Oil,Salt.. This dough is then shaped into thorny spiral patterns using a specially designed utensil or press.

The prepared dough is carefully deep-fried in hot oil until it turns golden brown and becomes crispy. The spiral shape gives it an attractive and unique look, making it a favorite among both kids and adults. The combination of flavors from the spices and the crunchy texture makes it a delightful and satisfying snack.

Mullu Muruku is popular in various states of South India, including Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Kerala, and Andhra Pradesh. While the core ingredients and preparation remain consistent, slight variations in the spice mix and regional preferences may exist.

Overall, Mullu Muruku is a beloved snack that holds cultural significance and is cherished by many as part of their culinary heritage. It is an excellent accompaniment to festive celebrations, family gatherings, and a delightful treat to relish on any occasion.

INGREDIENTS OF MULLU MURUKU

Rice Flour, Fried Farm, Urad Dhal, Moong Dhal, Refined Oil,Salt.

SERVING GUIDE OF MULLU MURUKU

Store in an airtight container.

SHELF LIFE OF MULLU MURUKU

30 days


Â

Garlic murukku is a crispy snack that comes from South India. It's like regular muruku but with garlic added for flavor. To make it, we mix rice flour, gram flour (besan), spices, and minced or powdered garlic. Then, we shape the dough into coils or spirals using a special tool and fry it until it's crunchy. Garlic murukku is a tasty snack enjoyed during festivals or as a treat with tea or coffee.

INGREDIENTSÂ 

Rice Flour, Fried Gram, Garlic, Red Chilly, Salt & Refined Vegetable Oil

SERVING GUIDE

Store in an airtight container

SHELF LIFE

30 days

Â 

Sesame laddu made with black sesame seeds, roasted peanuts and jaggery. Very special sweet in the kongunadu region. Sesame is an important seed used in Tamilnadu cuisine. Sesame and its oil is very traditional in this part of the world. Ellu Urundai is a kongunadu special sweet made with sesame as its main ingredient. Its really healthy and has very minimal ingredients. The Ellu Urundai from Pettikadai is made by traditional method using ural ulakkai (wooden mortar-pestle used for pounding grains).

Health Benefits
Ellu urundai is extremely nutritious as sesame contains several B vitamins, iron, magnesium, calcium, phosphorus, and zinc. Many articles also suggest that sesame consumption may help in small reductions in both systolic and diastolic blood pressure.

INGREDIENTSÂ 

Black Sesame seeds, Roasted peanuts and jaggery.

Store in a clean dry jar or airtight container.

SHELF LIFE

60 days

entry.title: INDIAN NATIVE COW GHEE
entry.summary:
Vendor: Vibis Honey Bee Farm
Type: Natural
Price: 790.00

This product contains Dairy items and cannot be shipped to EU and UK

Discover the Pure Goodness of Pettikadai Cow Ghee

Welcome to Pettikadai, where we bring you something truly special â€“ our Cow Ghee. We believe in keeping things simple, pure, and close to our roots. Let's dive into what makes our ghee unique.


Quality and Purity

Pettikadai A2 Desi Cow Ghee is all about top-notch quality. We get our milk from Desi cows known for their A2 goodness. These cows roam freely on natural pastures, giving us the purest milk without any funny business. No shortcuts, just genuine, high-quality ingredients.

Crafted the Old-Fashioned Way:

We like to do things the way our grandparents did â€“ with love and care. Our ghee is made in small batches using traditional methods. Skilled hands carefully turn the pure milk into ghee, preserving its natural richness and aroma. No fancy machines, just the warmth of tradition.

Authentic Ghee-Making Process in four simple steps :

  • Boil Raw A2 Milk
  • Make Curd using a Mudpot
  • Separate Butter from Curd using a wooden churner
  • Convert Butter to Pure Ghee using Brass bowls and packÂ 

Traditional Goodness:

In a world that's always in a rush, we find comfort in doing things the traditional way. Pettikadai A2 Desi Cow Ghee is a nod to the recipes that have stood the test of time. It's not just food; it's a journey back to the simple, wholesome goodness our grandparents enjoyed.

Why Pettikadai Ghee?

  • Real and Honest: We're all about being genuine. Our ghee is made authentically, just like it should be.
  • Pure Goodness: No additives or tricks â€“ just the pure goodness of A2 Desi Cow Ghee.
  • Health Boost: A2 Desi Cow Ghee has some great health benefits. We're here to share those benefits with you, the way nature intended.

      Shelf Life:

      Experience the pure goodness for an extended 24 months.


      Health Benefits:

      Revel in potential digestive aids, enhanced nutrient absorption, and reduced digestive issues for improved overall health.

      FAQs:

      Â  Â  Â  1.What is A2 Desi Cow Ghee?Â  Â 

      Â  Â  A type of clarified butter made from the milk of cows that produce A2 beta-casein protein, commonly found in native Indian breeds like Gir, Sahiwal, and Red Sindhi cows. Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â 

      Â  Â  Â 2.Â Is A2 Desi Cow Ghee lactose-free?Â  Â 

      Â  Â While not completely lactose-free, the ghee-making process removes most of the lactose.

      Explore Our Range:

      • Coconut Oil
      • Sesame Oil
      • Groundnut Oil

      Experience the pure goodness of A2 Desi Cow Ghee - order now for a wholesome culinary journey.

Thoothukudi Macaroon - Authentic South Indian Sweet

Thoothukudi Macaroons are a delightful and distinctive sweet treat originating from the coastal town of Thoothukudi in Tamil Nadu, India. Unlike traditional macaroons, Thoothukudi Macaroons are made with cashew nuts, sugar, and egg whites, creating a unique blend of crunchy and chewy textures. Their preparation involves meticulous handcrafting techniques passed down through generations, ensuring each macaroon embodies the authentic taste and tradition of South India. The use of high-quality cashew nuts gives them a rich, nutty flavor that sets them apart from other macaroons.

IngredientsÂ 

Cashew, Egg White, Powdered Sugar.

Serving GuideÂ 

Store in an airtight container to maintain crispness.

Shelf Life:

Enjoy the freshness for up to 15 days.

Why Buy Thoothukudi Macaroons from Pettikadai

At Pettikadai, we are committed to bringing you the finest traditional sweets with an emphasis on authenticity and quality. Hereâ€™s why you should choose our Thoothukudi Macaroons:

  1. Freshness Guaranteed: We ensure that our macaroons are freshly made and packed to preserve their delightful flavor and texture.
  2. Customer Satisfaction: Our customers' satisfaction is our top priority. We strive to provide exceptional service and ensure that every bite of our Thoothukudi Macaroons brings joy to your taste buds.

Â Experience the authentic taste of Thoothukudi with our delicious macaroons, made with love and tradition. Order now and indulge in this delightful South Indian treat!

If flying saucers were edible, the out of the world taste is whatÂ  'Thattai' is all about! Made with urad flour and seasoned with sesame and chillies, this spicy, fried snack has the zing that would make you addicted to its taste. A sure favourite snack among kids and adults alike, thattai stays an eternal favourite!

A mixture of all delicious and crunchy savouries, seasoned with groundnuts, spices and curry leaves is a signature snack of the famous original Shanthi Sweets, Tirunelveli, which has been an eternal favourite of people for years. Enjoy this savoury with tea or as an accompaniment with meals, and it is sure to keep your taste buds addicted!

Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â Save' your snack cravings for this delectable savoury, called Sattur 'Sev', maybe for a reason! From the authentic kitches in Sattur, this Sev has become an identity for its place of origin. Spicy, aromatic and crispy, this snack has stood the tests of time to reign supreme and become a people's favourite over the last century. entry.summary:

Type: Veg

This product contains Dairy items and cannot be shipped to EU and UK

If youâ€™re a fan of traditional South Indian sweets, you cannot miss out on Thoothukudi Nei Kuchi Mittai. This iconic delicacy, also known as nei kuchi mittai or simply kuchi mittai, originates from the coastal town of Thoothukudi, a place known for its rich culinary heritage. Each bite of this delicious treat offers an irresistible combination of crunchiness, nutty flavors, and the richness of pure ghee.

What is Thoothukudi Nei Kuchi Mittai?

Thoothukudi Nei Kuchi Mittai is a unique, bite-sized ghee sweet made from premium cashew nuts, cane sugar, and pure ghee. This delightful confection melts in your mouth, leaving behind a heavenly taste that lingers. Unlike other sweets, it has a light yet satisfying texture, making it a favorite treat for people of all ages.

Why is Thoothukudi Nei Kuchi Mittai Special?

âœ” Authentic Recipe â€“ Made using traditional methods perfected over generations, ensuring the same taste and texture as the original. âœ” Premium Ingredients â€“ Crafted with high-quality cashew nuts, pure ghee, and natural cane sugar for the best flavor and crunch. âœ” Mouthwatering Taste â€“ The rich, buttery aroma of ghee combined with the nutty goodness of cashews makes it an irresistible treat. âœ” Perfect for All Occasions â€“ Whether itâ€™s a festival, celebration, or a personal indulgence, nei kuchi mittai adds joy to every moment. âœ” Long Shelf Life â€“ Freshness guaranteed for up to 20 days when stored properly.

The Legacy of Kuchi Mittai from Thoothukudi

Thoothukudi has long been associated with sweets that are deeply rooted in tradition. Among them, kuchi mittai holds a special place. Generations of sweet makers have carefully crafted this delicacy using time-honored techniques that enhance its taste and texture. The secret behind its unparalleled flavor lies in the use of freshly ground cashews, slow-roasted in pure ghee, and blended with the perfect amount of cane sugar to create a delicately crispy yet melt-in-the-mouth treat.

Serving Guide â€“ How to Enjoy Thoothukudi Nei Kuchi Mittai?

To savor the best taste and texture of nei kuchi mittai, follow these simple tips:

  • Store in an Airtight Container â€“ Keeps the crunchiness intact for a longer duration.

  • Enjoy at Room Temperature â€“ The flavors are best appreciated when the sweet is not too cold.

  • Pair with Filter Coffee or Tea â€“ A delightful combination that enhances the richness of the treat.

Why Buy Thoothukudi Nei Kuchi Mittai from Pettikadai?

At Pettikadai, we bring the finest traditional sweets to your doorstep with a guarantee of authenticity and quality. Hereâ€™s why you should choose us:

âœ” Authentic & Fresh â€“ We source our Thoothukudi Nei Kuchi Mittai directly from expert sweet makers who follow traditional recipes.Â âœ”Â No Preservatives or Artificial Additives â€“ 100% natural ingredients, ensuring a pure and wholesome treat. âœ” Hygienic Packaging â€“ Packed carefully to preserve taste, texture, and freshness. âœ” Fast & Reliable Delivery â€“ Get your favorite sweets delivered anywhere with ease. âœ” Loved by Thousands â€“ Trusted by sweet lovers who crave authenticity and quality.

Order Thoothukudi Nei Kuchi Mittai Online â€“ Relish the Authentic Taste

Now, you donâ€™t have to travel to Thoothukudi to enjoy this traditional delicacy. With Pettikadaiâ€™s online store, you can order Thoothukudi Nei Kuchi Mittai, nei kuchi mittai, and kuchi mittai with just a few clicks. Whether youâ€™re treating yourself or looking for the perfect gift for a loved one, this delightful sweet is the best choice.

ğŸ Perfect for Festivals, Weddings, and Special Occasions!

Authentic Srivilliputhur Palkova - Rich, creamy, pure and made with love. Buy this melt-in-mouth treat now!

Note: Contains Dairy items and cannot be shipped to EU and UK.

Product Information

Â Ingredients:

Milk and Sugar
Â 

Shelf Life:Â 

12 days


Â Storage and serving guide:

Store in a stainless-steel container. Refrigerate if needed. For the best experience, heat for 5 minutes before consuming.

Story of Srivilliputhur Palkova

Â 


The story of Srivilliputhur Palkova began in 1921 when Dev Singh, a Rajput, set up a sweet stall near the Andal temple in Srivilliputhur. He created this delicious, sweet using just two basic ingredients: milk and sugar. The resulting treat, Palkova, is known for its incredibly sweet taste.

Why People Trust Srivilliputhur Palkova?


True food lovers believe that Palkova tastes best when made with milk from the Srivilliputhur region which is located in southern Tamil Nadu. Recognizing its unique origin, Srivilliputhur Palkova even received the Geographical Indication (GI) tag in 2019.


Why Buy Our Palkova?

  • Sourced from renowned shops to ensure the highest quality and authentic taste.

  • Prepared using traditional method: Slow-cooked fresh milk and sugar

  • Â It is not just a sweet, but a bite of great South Indian culture

  • Â Well packed - Ideal for festivals, gifting & celebrations

Â FAQs about Srivilliputhur Palkova

What is the price of Srivilliputhur palkova?

A 250g pack of genuine Palkova is priced at INR 190, made using traditional methods and fresh milk for rich flavor and quality.
